by Graham Williams

Section H CTAN Edition

Welcome to the XML based and XSL generated version of The TeX Catalogue Online, Section H CTAN Edition. This is a listing of entries in the TeX Catalogue and may take a little time to load, but is hopefully worth it. Have a look at the Catalogue Preface for alternative ways of accessing the catalogue.

The TeX Catalogue Online is also available from any CTAN node or mirror, including the following. Pick one that is close to you. (The "search" link attempts to find a CTAN node that may be close to you, courtesy of Randy Kobes. Multiple clicks may find alternatives.)



search

aarnet

switch

cstug

dante

loria

tex

roma

riken

gust

rge

ctan

Icons associated with many entries in the catalogue allow you to:

  • view the directory on CTAN
  • view documentation (possibly many)
  • view documentation in PDF format (requires the acroread plugin)
  • jump to the package's home page
  • download a gzip'd tar file from a nearby CTAN node (not supported by all nodes)
  • download a gzip'd tar file from ftp.dante.de

Other icons simply provide further information about the package:

  • part of the teTeX distribution
  • available on the TeX Live CD ROM

The license type, version (if known), and the date of the last change made to each particular Catalogue entry are also provided.

This compilation Copyright (c) 1998, 1999 Graham J. Williams. Last modified 1999/05/13.

Use of these web documents and information contained herein is subject to the CSIRO Legal Notice and Disclaimer.

hands Pointing hand fonts.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
hangcaption No caption.
Defines a variant of the caption command to produce captions with hanging indentation.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
hanging Hanging paragraphs.
The hanging package facilitates the typesetting of hanging paragraphs. It also enables typesetting with hanging punctuation (this is probably best regarded as a curiosity).
license: lppl (1998/12/11)
harpoon Extra harpoons, using the graphics package.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
harvard The Harvard bibliography style family.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
harvmac Paul Ginsparg's Harvard macros for scientific articles.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
hellas No caption.
A BibTeX style for typesetting databases that containing both Greek and non-Greek bibliographic records.
license: unknown (1998/03/10)
here No caption.
Provides the H option for floats in LaTeX to mean that the float should really be placed here. It has been removed from CTAN at the request of the author. LaTeX2e now has a \! option and [!ht] usually does what the user of H expects and has the big advantage of guaranteeing that floats stay in the right order. See the float package for an alternative which does include H for LaTeX2e.
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
hh Fancy boxing effects.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
hhline Better horizontal lines in tabulars and arrays.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
hilowres No caption.
A package to simplify the inclusion of low resolution versions of high resolution images, if each pair of files have the same basename (e.g., bird.low.eps and bird.eps). The package is a simple wrapper around the \includegraphics command of the graphicx package.
license: unknown (1999/01/21)
histogr Drawing histograms with the LaTeX picture environment.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
hlatex No caption.
Support for Korean documents written in Korean standard KSC codes for LaTeX2e.
license: unknown version: 0.98 (1997/05/28)
hoekwater No caption.
Fonts originally created in MetaFont, transformed to PostScript by Taco Hoekwater; includes logo, manfnt, rsfs, stmaryrd, wasy, wasy2, xipa.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
hrhyph No caption.
Hyphenation patterns for the Croatian language for use with T1 (and OT1) encoding as supported in DC fonts.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
html Various TeX documentation converted to HTML.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
html2latex No caption.
The html2latex package compiled from the Unix sources version 0.9c with emx 0.9c fix 2 to run on MS-DOS, MS-Windows (3.x, 9x, NT), OS/2 Warp
license: unknown (1998/09/30)
huhyph Hyphenation patterns for the Hungarian language.
license: unknown (1998/11/5)
hvdashln No caption.
Definitions of horizontal and vertical dashed lines for the array and tabular environment. Instead of building partial horizontal dashed lines using Isozaki's \cline{2-3}, \hdashline fills the full width. The proportion of the dashed line is defined by the two parameters: \hdashlinewidth=2pt and \hdashlinegap=2pt, where the former defines the width of the dash and the latter sets their gap.
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
hvmath Support for using the Micropress HV-Math fonts.
Typeset math in a style that suits the Adobe Helvetica text fonts. Math fonts for use with Helvetica are generally otherwise not available, and a free, bitmapped version of HV-Math can be downloaded from Micropress. Commercial versions of the HT-Math fonts are available from Micropress. See also tmmath
license: lppl (1999/03/31)
hypbmsec Hypertext bookmarks in sectioning commands.
Bookmark entries can be given as another argument of the LaTeX sectioning commands. The hyperref package is required to get the bookmarks, but the syntax works without it.
license: lppl version: 2.0 (1999/04/12) (1999/04/14)
hyper Hypertext cross referencing.
Redefines LaTeX cross-referencing commands to insert \special commands for HyperTeX dvi viewers, such as recent versions of xdvi .
license: lppl (1999/04/15)
hyperlatex No caption.
A package that allows you to prepare documents in HTML and to produce a neatly printed document from your input using LaTeX. It is not a LaTeX to html converter (see ltoh or latex2html for that). See also tth
license: unknown version: 2.3.1 (1998/12/27)
hyperref Support for hypertext.
The hyperref package is used to handle cross-referencing commands in LaTeX to produce some sort of hypertext command; there are backends for the \special set defined for HyperTeX dvi processors, for embedded pdfmark commands for processing by Acrobat Distiller ( dvips and dvipsone), for dviwindo, for pdfTeX , for TeX4ht , and for VTEX's pdf and HTML backends.
license: lppl version: 6.56 (1999/04/14)
hyphenat Disable/enable hypenation.
This package can disable all hyphenation or enable hyphenation of non-alphabetics or monospaced fonts. Enables hyphenation within `words' that contain non-alphabetic characters (e.g., that include underscores), and hyphenation of text typeset in monospaced (e.g., cmtt) fonts.
license: lppl version: 2.3 (1999/02/22)
hypht1 No caption.
Additional hyphenation patterns which have to be loaded in conjunction with each ``normal'' set of patterns. It contains patterns to allow hyphenation after an explicit - letter, which are needed if you want to use e.g. the second hyphen character (\char127) of the EC fonts or any other T1 encoded font as \hyphenchar\font.
license: unknown (1997/05/3)
